Hi,

Could you confirm what time the countdown clock will tick over to read '500 days to go'?  If it's at midnight can it be changed to 1930 this evening, to coincide with the launch of the countdown clock?  (Previous games have apparently received negative press when the website hasn't updated to coincide with this major announcement.)

If this isn't technically possible could we also look at a couple of alternatives:

1.       Replace the clock with an identical-looking image at 1930.  We can swap it back again tomorrow.

2.       Temporarily remove the countdown timer from the homepage.  (Least preferable option.)

Andy

comments.value:
Duncan and I were just running through with Uzma the templates/pages that we need to send to Russ@ITS tomorrow morning for testing and came across a few issues. We really need to solve these before handing over to ITS so they test the finished template, or as close to it. Can you look at these this evening so we’re ready to go tomorrow am?
 
Greenwich page (template V)
·         Can the image size for the ‘Travel to Greenwich’ promo be the same size as the images on the Map (M) template? Just saves Uzma cropping the same image to two different sizes.
·         In the local attraction promo, only the first link has an external window icon – whereas all three should.
 
The UK venues promo
Can we edit the image/link and header, as on many of the pages we’ll need one or the other? This will also allow us to update the UK image in house, which we’ll need to do.
 
Most importantly, the Journey Time Finder doesn’t function now it’s pre-populated. It’s really important that this works for ITS as this will be the one thing that ITS focus on. If the only way to9 make it work is to NOT pre-populate the ‘from’ field.
 
Is there anything you can do to beautify the pop-up window? It should really be in the same font as the website and a little more on brand – can you alter the colour/style at all? I fear LOCOG will throw this out as it is. (Baby with the bathwater…)
 
Template C2
This should have the UK map promo (now editable, see point two)
 
Note: The venue selector should only appear on page 2.0 – Locations of venues index page, not all pages using C2. And in fact this particular page is an index page so should use template C1
 
Template L1 (page 0.0, Getting to the Games) should have the Journey time finder promo and top tips.
 
Template C1 should have the top tips and journey time finder promos, and the UK map promo (now editable, see point two) but not the ‘Plan now’ promo. Currently the C1 pages have the ‘plan now’ promo twice but no others.
 
We’ve yet to send any pages to the staging server as I figured you’d need to do the above before we do that.
 
Any questions, drop me a line or call on the mobile below.
 
Cheers
Simon
Marking as solved. Included in #2446.

Liz, I am not sure we will be able to get a response to this before Monday. How urgent is it?
It would be really good to get sorted – there are quite a few of timely photos we’d like to get up. Could it be a priority for the remainder of the day?

Liz,

Looking at http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php, I don't see anything waiting to go, as described by Justin yesterday.

Could you (or somebody) re-submit any images that apparently didn't make it through in the usual way and then let us know that you have done so and confirm that they have turned up at gettyftp.kitsite.com. We can then have a look and try to work out what the problem is.

It would also be useful to know what the images were that didn't make it through yesterday.

None of the code been touched on our end for some time, so I am a bit mystified as to what the problem might be (other than Jamie's suggestion that the image might have been missing).

Justin, do you mind re-sending one of the Getty pics? And could you reply-all to this and tell us the name of some of the pics you already tried to send through?

Cheers,

Liz

Hi all. Justin's just sent some more images through as I said to Danny on the phone:


http://mm.gettyimages.com/mm/nicePath/locog?nav=pr147450472 – Link to images in Getty MM

http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php - images showing as waiting to go to web
Any news on this folks. We've had more images come through today so it's odd that the CGIs don't work.

Hi Finn,

It's the 'Â©Te' at the start of <gyi:value name='Filename'>Â©Team_Populous_2012Greenwich[1].jpg</gyi:value>

Any chance you could rename and resend.

btw. there was talk, many moon ago :) of Getty exposing a proper web API so we can dump the current feed and FTP servers and switch to a proper web service, that would make so much easier as Getty could just poll us when they had new images, we could then fetch that image and if there was any issues automatically email the relevant people. What we have currently is a bit string and tape, as Getty FTP an XML file and hopefully an image to an intermediate FTP sever, we then try and pick up those XML files and look for the images referenced in the XML file, which sometimes haven't made it across to the FTP server or have otherwise been corrupted.

Still doesn’t seem to be working I’m afraid Jamie, another picture didn’t come through last night. This is from Justin:


I have sent through the image filenames below. they are showing here http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php but they are not getting to the web. Please note the first 3 images on the link are the CGI’s with the filenames with bad characters that I have adjusted and they can be seen further down the list.

AE4Q0094
Greenwich_CGI_Team_Populous_2012
Broxbourne_CGI_Team_Populous_2012
Lords_CGI_Team_Populous_2012
Horse_Guards_Parade_TEAM_POPULOUS_2012
Can we please treat this as top priority until it is fixed? Jamie, if you are struggling to find images, or need more to be sent through, I recommend you call Justin directly to re-send.

Liz just so I am clear, are you saying *no* images are coming across?

They seem to be appearing here?
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/Photo%20pages

Maybe Justin isn't aware that there is a delay in sending the image out of Getty and arriving in the CSM? From the very start we suggested using a web service to handle this process (for thsi and other reasons) but I think Getty only got as far as saying one might be built in future.

There have been two real issues with the Getty feed this year that I am aware of:

1) Bad characters, this /isn't/ just a case of non alphanumeric chars rather what looks like computer generated data characters at the start of the title (even if we could deal with these, it would be unwise to bring them into the CMS)
2) An old (and reported issue) with Media Manager whereby if you chose the wrong target or send an image in a slightly different way in Media Manger (I never understood the *exact* reasons) we only get the CML file and not the image. As far as I am aware this is not a recurring issue and if images are sent in the way Justin seems to be sending them then there shouldn't be an issue.

If there is a wider issue, then we need to trace though the images from Getty (checking how they are sent; as I said I don't know the correct way; I just know one way previously caused the XML to be sent without the JPG) though the FTP server and into the CMS. It would be good if this is the case to set aside an hour where we can run though this process in real time and check the image at each step of the way.
Yep, they seem to have come through, you’re right

Oops, trigger happy with the send button then.

I’ll talk to Justin about the delay...

Righty, they’re definitely in CMS as you say. I think Justin’s confusion is that they’re not appearing in the Latest Photos feed: http://www.london2012.com/photos/search.php . Are they supposed to automatically publish to that?
They are – but it actually depends on the time stamp. Is it possible that they are stamped with either: no date or a date awhile in the past??

Ah well spotted Liz !!

That would be it

Apparently Justin says that the date field specifically is getting lost from the Getty ‘created date’ in the CMS. It’s not ideal – could you take a look and see if there’s any obvious reason why the date would be getting stripped out?

Liz,

There is a date field called 'post date' which is the only that one is used (as it was considered the editorial date, in case you want to 'fake' the date that appears on a given photo)

Is that the one that is being used? Hard to tell as I can't see any files on the FTP server or else I'd check myself.

thanks

Jamie

Is ‘post date’ a kitsite field, or the field you are looking for from Getty? Justin can manually add dates in the CMS, his concern is that the date he is entering into Getty isn’t making it into the Kitsite system.

No it's an 'extra' Getty field, it should be in MediaManager but may not appear in the general interfaces, it's not a normal MediaManger date field.

Liz..apologies for not knowing much about MediaManger we didn't really have much to do with that end of things, we just got he value in the exported XML files.
